name: Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
description: In this satisfying centerpiece dish from Chloe Coscarelli, the vegan chef and cookbook author, portobello mushroom caps are filled with savory lentil cashew stuffing, topped with a slice of tomato and fresh thyme leaves then baked until golden brown and bubbly. It is hearty fare that will surprise and delight everyone at your table.
keywords: cashew, lentils, portobello, dairy-free, kosher, vegan, vegetarian, fall, main course
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons olive oil, plus extra for brushing
1 cup cooked brown rice (or grain of choice)
1 tablespoon fresh thyme leaves plus extra for garnish
6 portobello mushrooms, stems and gills removed

recipeInstructions.text: In large skillet, sauté the onions and cashews with 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium high heat. Season with salt and pepper to taste, and sauté until onions are soft and lightly browned. Add garlic and let cook a few more minutes.

In a large bowl combine onion mixture, brown rice, lentils, breadcrumbs, vegetable broth, basil and thyme. Mix together and season to taste with salt and pepper. (The stuffing can be made up to three days in advance and stored covered in the refrigerator.)

Brush both sides of mushroom caps lightly with olive oil and place top-side down on an oiled sheet pan. Stuff mushrooms with about 1/2 cup lentil cashew stuffing, then press one tomato slice on top of the stuffing. (The mushrooms can be stuffed and assembled on a baking tray the day before you plan to bake and serve them.)
Bake for approximately 30 minutes, or until the stuffing is browned and the mushroom begins releasing juices. Garnish with extra fresh thyme leaves.
